etymologies: late 19th century: from Sanskrit svastika, from svasti ‘well-being’, from su ‘good’ + asti ‘being’

definitions: an ancient symbol in the form of an equal-armed cross with each arm continued at a right angle, used (in clockwise form) as the emblem of the German Nazi party.
shortDefinitions: ancient symbol in form of equal-armed cross with each arm continued at right angle, used in clockwise form as emblem of German Nazi party
